name: 21c Museum Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. I would give this hotel 5 stars for the vibe and the chic factor. But I give it 4 since it made me feel like I wasn't a well traveled person (mind you I travel 3-4days out of the week!).
reviews.title: Amazing property but a bit too techy
A treat!
reviews.text: We walked in and didn't know where to check in...it was that cool. It felt like an Apple store with everyone looking at computers. The room was lovely. Nice linen etc. Decor was ultra modern and again very cool. Location was great. Walking distance to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't personally bring my 2 boys (5&3) here since it was that chic...I would be stressed the whole time that they were touching something they shouldn't. So for solo/romantic couples/business it's great and I would recommend it to those folks.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Oh and despite how busy the street was below...it was SUPER quiet!
reviews.title: Wow, 21c is excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love the art and contemporary feel! Great boutique hotel!
reviews.title: 21c museum hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and fun and in a great location. But for the price I expect to be able to sleep without hearing loud music coming from the bar. And we were on the 8th floor. This totally ruined the experience and will stop me from staying here again.
reviews.title: Noise ruined the experience.

reviews.text: Really enjoyed this hotel. Great downtown location. New and very clean rooms. Great hotel staff. Stayed 4 nights had no problems at all. Wonderful and very interesting art on every floor of the hotel. This was a very unique place to stay. Great restaurant. Will stay again next time we visit Cincinnati.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Cincinnati for the express purpose of staying in this hotel.
reviews.title: Top Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vibe: Nothing compares to it... it is incredible
reviews.title: Everything Was Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: Friendly, helpful
reviews.title: 5 stars from us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visiting for the Xavier commencement from out of town, my wife and I wanted to stay downtown to enjoy the restaurants and events around the hotel. It seemed that in order to stay in the area, one had to evaluate what was included in your stay and how much of a charge you were willing to accept for features. Common fees were assessed for parking, wifi, and room upgrades. It turns out that for what you pay, 21C offered the larger HDTV with premium channels, bath amenities unlike any other hotel in the area, complimentary in-room coffee and water and free speedy wireless internet. Best of all, the art is amazing. It is a rather interesting touch to incorporate what would normally be boring walls and elevator with refreshing artistic pieces.
reviews.title: Sets the standard for hotels inside and outside of Cincinnati

reviews.text: The design of the room was welcoming, not overly lit, and maintained a comfortable temperature. Our room had a comfortable sized queen bed with down comforter and high quality linens. as well as a bathroom which is large, clean and a shower head that leaves one relaxed and refreshed. The floor is even textured and is not outside of a comfortable range for enhanced barefoot walking. Last, the room can be made quite dark due built-in shutters and extra thick curtains.
reviews.title: Treat yourself! Pricey, but worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, we did not get a chance to try the spa or try the restaurant, but we did use the gym which had state of the art ellipticals and cycles. A broad range of free weights and it also had nice touches like water, fresh towels, and cleaning wipes.
reviews.title: Adventure gone South

reviews.text: We will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, but a bit noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent stylish Mid-Century Modern design boutique hotel in the heart of everything! Loved the design and loved the service. Service was very "Disneyesque": everyone we encountered seemed genuinely happy to see us and to assist us. Pricey, but definitely worth it. Looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: 21C Gets It Right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cool, trendy and unique hotel/museum. It is a top tier boutique hotel that happens to have an art museum on the 1st & 2nd floors and an outstanding restaurant. Staff is very friendly. There is not a traditional registration desk. In fact, the check-in "desk" is a piece of artwork. Everything is done from a laptop computer, including coding the room keys. The registrar even walks you to the elevator. They hotel is very modern and clean. It just opened in the fall of 2012. The rooms are spacious, clean and user friendly. We were greeted by a rubber duck in the shower. In fact, we were greeted at dinner, in the hallway and on the elevator by an occasional yellow penguin (part of the Cracking Art Group exhibit). The hotel restaurant, Meteropole, is a must. The location is great. Head one block south and you are at Fountain Square, the hub of the city. You are also within walking distance of the brand new Horseshoe Casino, Great American Ball Park, the Paul Brown Stadium.
reviews.title: All That and a Rubber Ducky!

reviews.text: My weekend stay was made very enjoyable by the fun details in the decor and the excellent service provided by the front desk staff. Upon arrival I requested ice for a bottle of champagne. The staff delivered it ultra promptly as I was entering my room. The yellow penguins are a charming little motif that you will see here and there. They are even used on the lapel pins that identify hotel staff. Take a closer look at the tiles in your bathroom and you will notice something unusual...a bas relief belly button, nose, lips, and other body parts are subtly interspersed with the regular flat tiles. The rooms are decorated in a mid century modern style without being cold or clinical. Don't leave without checking out the museum on the first and second floors. I think I have a new favorite place to stay when I'm in Cincinnati.
reviews.title: Full of Surprises (in a good way)

reviews.text: This former apartment building is now a nice hotel. right next to it is Nicholson's Tavern (scottish food) and across the street is the Arnoff Center for the Arts (Sister Act and such). Lovely place to stay, from what i hear.
reviews.title: right in the middle of it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my husband at the hotel April 26 to 28th. Check-in was very easy. Front desk area is minimalistic. I love it, however some guests may walk right by not realizing it. The hotel is ultra modern with various museum pieces on the first and 2nd floor. Wifi card key secures only hotel guests can access the floor of the room registered in. We stayed in a Deluxe King room, which is the basic of all room types, but was anything but basic. Everything about the room was outstanding. The bed and pillows were deliciously comfortable. Simply a gorgeous modern appointed room. The bathroom decor was modern and fun with whimsical tile. Lovely Malin+Goetz travel size toiletries were very welcoming.
reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations!!

reviews.text: The staff was welcoming and professional. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant Metropole was delicious. Conveniently located across from the Aronoff Center. Walkable everywhere within the downtown corridor. The only downside to our stay was our room was located on north side of the 5th floor next to Nicholson's Pub. The pub was quite loud and could be heard until closing at 2:00 am.
reviews.title: Good Stay in Cincinnati

description: Located adjacent to the Lois and Richard Rosenthal Center for Contemporary Art and across the street from the Aronoff Center for the Arts, 21c Cincinnati works to foster the ongoing revival of Downtown Cincinnati and strengthen its role as a cultural destination.Working with the Cincinnati Center City Development Corporation (3CDC), 21c renovated the former Metropole Hotel and embraced the architecture of the historic landmark to create an exciting new space for guests to experience genuine hospitality, view cutting edge contemporary art, and enjoy culinary experiences that celebrates the region's sustainable producers.
